PC Japanese (JP): 親たちは、真里亞を連れてゲストハウスに行っていろと一方的に命じると、自分たちは食堂に閉じこもり、ますますに遺産の話で盛り上がるのだった。

Steam (ST): It seemed that, because of that strange letter, Uncle Krauss's chances of becoming the next Head might've been reduced to a blank slate, and in exchange for accepting him, my dad and the rest were trying to swindle Uncle Krauss out of a lot of money...or something like that.
Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that, because of that strange letter, the possibility had arisen that Uncle Krauss's ability to become the next head could be returned to a blank slate, and in exchange for accepting him, my dad and the rest were trying to swindle Uncle Krauss out of a lot of money...or something like that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed that, because of that strange letter, the possibility had appeared that Krauss oji-san's ability to become the next head had been reduced to a blank slate, and in exchange for accepting him, my dad and the rest were trying to swindle Krauss oji-san out of a lot of money..., something like that.
PC Japanese (JP): どうやら、おかしな手紙のせいで、蔵臼伯父さんが次の当主になるという話が白紙に戻る可能性が出てきていて、それを認める見返りに親父たちが蔵臼伯父さんから大金をせしめる…、みたいな感じのようだった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parecia que, por causa daquela estranha carta, surgiu a possibilidade do tio Krauss não se tornar mais o chefe por meio da sucessão direta. E para aceitar isso, meu pai, junto aos outros, estão tentando barganhar uma grande quantia de dinheiro com o tio Krauss...ou algo assim.

Turkish (TR): ...Neden böyle düşündüğünü anlayabiliyordum. Bu para konusu ne kadar iğrenç olursa olsun, gözlerinizi kapatsanız da geçmeyecekti.

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Steam (ST): "There are only 18 people on this island now. The thought that, somewhere in the rain, a 19th person gave Maria-chan that letter and is now hiding somewhere... doesn't seem realistic at all."
Umineko Project (UP): "There are only 18 people on this island now. The thought that, in the middle of all this rain, an unknown 19th person gave Maria‐chan that letter, and is now hiding somewhere, honestly doesn't seem realistic at all."

Russian (RU): "...Поскольку вид Анеки говорит о её плохом настроении, я воздержусь от перерыва. Но я согласен насчёт прохладительных напитков. Роза, пусть кто‐нибудь принесёт немного воды. Полный кувшин."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi

Umineko Project (UP): ".........A mysterious 19th visitor. Sounds pretty interestin', just like a mystery novel. Normally, in that kind of story, it's a safe bet that the person doesn't exist, that one of us 18 would be fakin' it."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Uma misteriosa 19ª visitante. Parece bem interessante, assim como um livro de mistério. Normalmente, nesse tipo de história, é uma aposta segura supor que essa pessoa não existe, e que um de nós está se passando por ela."

It was not out of the ordinary for him to shut himself up in some archive after purposefully not telling anyone where he was going."

It wouldn't have been out of the ordinary for him to shut himself up in some archive after purposefully not telling anyone where he was going.
PC Japanese (JP): 「……親父殿はかつて、不意に所在を知らせずに姿を消すことがあった。何しろ、静寂を好むお人だからな。わざと所在を知らせず、どこかの書庫に閉じ篭っているなどということは、別に不思議なことではなかったよ。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Steam (ST): "Mom was totally paranoid in her last years. She'd sometimes suddenly start making a fuss, asking the servants to start looking for Dad immediately because of some urgent situation."
Umineko Project (UP): "Mom was completely overridden with doubt in her final years. Sometimes, she'd suddenly start making a racket and asking the servants to look for Dad immediately, saying it was an emergency."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Mom was completely overridden with doubt in her final years. She would sometimes suddenly start making a racket, asking the servants to start looking for Father immediately because of some urgent situation."
PC Japanese (JP): 「末期のお袋は疑心暗鬼の塊だったからな。突然大騒ぎして使用人たちに、緊急事態だから今すぐ親父を探せなんて騒ぎ始めることがあったっけ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「末期のお袋は疑心暗鬼の塊だったからな。突然大騒ぎして使用人たちに、緊急事態だから今すぐ親父を探せなんて騒ぎ始めることがあったっけ」
Russian (RU): "Маму вконец одолели сомнения в её последние годы. Она иногда внезапно поднимала шум, прося слуг, чтобы те немедленно отправились на поиски отца из‐за какой‐нибудь важной ситуации."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A mãe ficou completamente paranoica em seus últimos anos de vida. Algumas vezes, ela começava a fazer algazarras e pedia para os serviçais irem procurar pelo pai imediatamente, mandando dizer que era uma emergência."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「臨終前的老媽，簡直就是疑心病的代言人。我記得有一回，她突然大吵大鬧，宣布這是緊急事態，叫傭人們立刻去把爸找出來，搞得天下大亂吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「临终前的老妈，简直就是疑心病的代言人。我记得有一回，她突然大吵大闹，宣布这是紧急事态，叫佣人们立刻去把爸找出来，搞得天下大乱吧？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Mamma era completamente dominata dal dubbio nei suoi ultimi anni. A volte iniziava improvvisamente a fare baccano, chiedendo ai domestici di iniziare a cercare nostro Padre immediatamente per via di qualche situazione urgente."
Turkish (TR): "Annem son yıllarında tamamen paranoyak olmuştu. Bazen aniden yaygara koparır ve hizmetkârlardan acil bir durum olduğunu söyleyerek hemen Babamı aramalarını isterdi."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Sim, isso costumava acontecer. Ela sempre fez coisas assim em seus últimos anos, e aquela assustadora atmosfera ainda não desapareceu até hoje. ...Eu posso dizer isso com certeza agora. Ela era uma pessoa digna de pena."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あぁ。どんなに屋敷中を探しても見付からないんだから、親父は屋敷の外へ行っているのだろうという見解になった。だが、屋敷の外ったって、それほど大した場所はない。……となると残るのは、広大な森だ」

Turkish (TR): "Evet. Malikanenin içinde ne kadar ararsak arayalım onu bulamadığımız için, Babamın malikanenin dışında bir yere gitmiş olabileceği düşüncesi de giderek güçlendi. Ama malikânenin dışındaki alanda bahsedilecek pek bir şey yok. ......Bu da geriye sadece geniş bir orman bırakıyor."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "The witch sent us a letter of challenge, forcing us to try and solve the epitaph. She might be taking us lightly, thinking we could never solve it. ...However, at the very least, there ought to be an extremely small chance that we do solve it."
Umineko Project (UP): "The witch sent us a letter of challenge, telling us to try to solve the epitaph. She might be taking us lightly, thinking we could never solve it. ......However, there should be at least an extremely small chance that we will solve it."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The witch sent us a letter of challenge, forcing us to try and solve the epitaph. She might be taking us lightly, thinking we could never solve it. ......However, there should be at least an extremely small chance that we will solve it.
PC Japanese (JP): 「魔女は、碑文を解いてみろと私たちに挑戦状を送ったわ。どうせ解けないだろうと、タカを括ってるでしょうけどね。……でも、何万分の一かの確率で、私たちが解いてしまう可能性もあるはず。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「魔女は、碑文を解いてみろと私たちに挑戦状を送ったわ。どうせ解けないだろうと、タカを括ってるでしょうけどね。……でも、何万分の一かの確率で、私たちが解いてしまう可能性もあるはず」
Russian (RU): "Ведьма послала нам письмо с вызовом, принуждая попытаться разгадать эпитафию. Она не воспринимает нас всерьёз, думая, что мы никогда её не разгадаем. ......Тем не менее, должен иметься хотя бы ничтожный шанс, что мы её разгадаем."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A bruxa nos enviou uma carta de desafio, nos dizendo para tentarmos resolver o epitáfio. Ela pode estar nos subestimando, pensando que nunca conseguiríamos resolver. ......No entanto, deve haver ao menos uma chance extremamente pequena de resolvermos."

Potrebbe prenderci alla leggera, dicendo che non riusciremo mai a risolverla. ... Comunque, ci dovrebbe essere una possibilità estremamente piccola che la possiamo risolvere.

Umineko Project (UP): "After all, we have here four of Father's children by blood, right? Four people related by blood to the questioner, who, if they tried frantically to work together and avoid having those assets stolen from them, might come across the answer of the riddle by chance."
